article.headline: Trump may not be âout of the woods yet,â as he leaves hospital, doctor says
article.body: President Donald Trump has met or exceeded discharge criteria after being treated for COVID-19, but is not âout of the woodsâ yet, his physician told reporters Monday. Speaking at Walter Reed hospital in Bethesda, Md., Dr. Sean Conley said the presidentâs team supported his âsafe return home, where heâll be surrounded by world-class medical care 24/7.â The White House doctor said if Trumpâs team can get him through to Monday, they will take a âdeep sigh of relief.â Conley spoke to reporters shortly after Trump himself tweeted that he would be leaving the facility Monday evening. âFeeling really good!â Trump said. âDonât be afraid of Covid,â he added. âDonât let it dominate your life.â The comment raised criticism on social media, as U.S. deaths from COVID-19 neared 210,000. U.S. stocks DJIA, +0.56% Â rebounded strongly on Monday, as investors looked past the presidential health woes. Now see:As Dow jumps over 400 points, history shows investors are quick to brush off presidential health woes.
